node.title: Ukraine and Russia: What you need to know right now
node.description: Here's what you need to know about the Ukraine crisis as Russia continues a major military assault.

node.title: Blinken says Putin has his sights on countries beyond Ukraine
node.description: The secretary of state said he is concerned about the safety of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other government officials still in the country.

node.title: 'They are terrified' - Ukrainian student's horror over Russian attack
node.description: A Ukrainian woman in New Zealand has spent all morning on the phone to her family at home, who are sheltering underground as shockwaves rattle the bunker.

node.title: Ex-police officers guilty of violating George Floyd's rights
node.description: The verdict is a rare instance of police officers being held criminally responsible for a colleague's excessive force.

node.title: 'I don't know what to do': fleeing Ukrainians start arriving in central Europe
node.description: Thousands of Ukrainians fleeing war with Russia have started arriving in neighbouring central European countries and the region braced for many more.

node.title: Former defendants in execution-style killing to keep name suppression
node.description: The identities of three men previously charged over the murder of Upper Hutt woman Lois Tolley in 2016 will remain secret for the foreseeable future.

node.title: Early childhood centres fear closures as Omicron spreads
node.description: Groups representing early learning service owners and managers say there is already a teacher shortage and many services will not be able to find enough relievers to stay open if staff caughtâ€¦

node.title: TVNZ's half-year profits plunge
node.description: Television New Zealand's first half profit is down 55 percent, with a substantial increase in spending on local content and other expenses.

node.title: 'I don't know how long I can do this': Auckland medics under pressure in Omicron outbreak
node.description: Frontline health workers are feeling the pressure as the Omicron outbreak rapidly escalates in Auckland.

node.title: Russian invasion of Ukraine won't affect New Zealand fuel - Minister
node.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine will not directly affect New Zealand's fuel supply, Energy Minister Megan Woods says.

node.title: Burling and Tuke re-commit to Team NZ, won't compete at 2024 Olympics
node.description: Olympians Peter Burling and Blair Tuke have re-signed with Team New Zealand for the next America's Cup.

node.title: 'Institutional bias' a concern as coronial court hearing on mosque terror attacks ends
node.description: A coronial court heard from the Human Rights Commission and the terrorist's lawyer, in the final day of a scope hearing on the Christchurch terror attacks yesterday.

node.title: Florida House passes controversial "Don't Say Gay" bill
node.description: The bill would prohibit schools from discussing sexual orientation or gender identity with students in kindergarten through third grade, and limit discussions in higher grades.

node.title: Russia invades Ukraine in Europe's 'darkest hours' since WWII
node.description: Russian forces invaded Ukraine by land, air and sea on Thursday, confirming the worst fears of the West with the biggest attack by one state against another in Europe since World War II.

node.title: Millions of children have lost a parent or caregiver to COVID
node.description: Study's authors say their new data underscore the urgency for governments to address the pandemic's toll on orphaned children.

node.title: Massive winter storm to strike states with ice and snow
node.description: The storm system is expected to bring record-breaking low temperatures along with risks for power outages, hazardous travel and tree damage.

node.title: 'RATs demand can't be met': Pharmacies turning away customers
node.description: Pharmacies are being inundated with people keen to buy rapid antigen tests. Audio

node.title: Sanctions on Russia raise questions about space station
node.description: President Biden says new sanctions will degrade Russia's aerospace industry, "including their space program."

node.title: DWTS pro Maksim Chmerkovskiy sends emotional message from Kyiv
node.description: "There's ALWAYS another way!" Chmerkovskiy wrote Thursday. "WAR is NEVER an answer!

node.title: Former U.S. presidents respond to Russia's assault on Ukraine
node.description: Most of the former presidents called Russia's attack an assault on democracy and urged national unity.

node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: Three waters transition unit appointed
node.description: The three waters reform National Transition Unit board will be chaired by Waka Kotahi NZTA chair Sir Brian Roche, the government has announced.

node.title: Omicron phase three: Concern for vulnerable rural communities
node.description: There are fears the phase three Omicron response will see already-stretched rural health services in crisis as they try to care for increasing numbers of Covid-19 patients at home.

node.title: Verdict reached in federal civil rights trial over George Floyd's death
node.description: The jury heard four weeks of testimony in the civil rights trial of three former police officers involved in the death of George Floyd.

node.title: Ukrainian lawmaker's emotional plea as Russia attacks: "Please save our people"
node.description: "Dozens and maybe hundreds of people of mine are being murdered tonight," Ukrainian Parliament member Halyna Yanchenko told CBS News.

node.title: Covid-19: Shipment of 10 million rapid antigen tests due over weekend
node.description: The new shipment, along with tests that arrived in the last two days, will bring the country's stock to 22 million by Monday.

node.title: Timeline: From Ukraine's independence in 1991 to latest conflict
node.description: A look back at the main events in Ukraine's political history since it won independence from Moscow in 1991.

node.title: $4 per gallon gas across U.S. by April, one expert predicts
node.description: American motorists are in for at least some short-term pain at the fuel pump as oil and gas markets react to global conflict.

node.title: Person in wheelchair dies after waiting 6 hours for ambulance
node.description: First Union ambulance secretary Faye McCann says it is a heart-breaking situation that has hit staff hard. Audio
